Message.Title: "PS4 architect Mark Cerny promises 'strongest ever lineup' "
Message.Msg: "PS4 architect Mark Cerny promises 'strongest ever lineup' " "PlayStation 4's Mark Cerny has promised that the launch line-up for the console will be "stronger than any prior PlayStation hardware". Sony's lead system architect explained the console's Play-Go tech, which will allow users to begin playing partially downloaded games while they continue to download in the background, as well as copy data from Blu-rays to decrease loading times. "So, what we do as the game accesses the Blu-ray disc, is we take any data that was accessed and we put it on the hard drive," he told Gamasutra. "And then if there is idle time, we go ahead and copy the remaining data to the hard drive. And what that means is after an hour or two, the game is on the hard drive, and you have access, you have dramatically quicker loading... and you have the ability to do some truly high-speed streaming." Play-Go will also allow players to suspend and resume games without saving. Cerny added that it will take "weeks, not months" to port a game from PC to PS4. Sony has hinted at an affordable price for the PS4, which will launch worldwide in 2013." Source: digitalspy
